intro: Solena longispina, commonly known as the long-spined solena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Solena longispina is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
